intro: Alyssum euboeum, commonly known as Euboean alyssum, is a flowering plant native to the Greek island of Euboea. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many other flowering plants with small, four-petaled flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of about 10 to 30 centimeters and produces clusters of fragrant, white or pale yellow flowers. Its leaves are linear and arranged oppositely along the stems. Alyssum euboeum is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to coastal or Mediterranean climates.
